main event: Multiple sightings of flying objects were reported in Bellingham, Yakima, and Rosalin, Washington, including a bright, fluorescent bluish-white object, the size of a nickel or quarter, that faded out of sight in Bellingham in July 1959.
interesting points: The sightings included objects described as red, green, white, blue, and yellow, all occurring at night.

The 25th Air Division, McChord AFB, Washington conducted an investigation and determined that the sightings were associated with local weather radar elements and friendly SAC aircraft conducting a refueling mission.
The object in Bellingham was observed by civilians and described as very bright with flickering lights before fading out of sight in one to three minutes.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting included a strong stationary ridge of high pressure in the Gulf of Alaska dominating the entire area with relatively dry and stable air mass.
The report was brought to the attention of ATIC by a congressman of Washington, and the findings were requested to be communicated to him.
sighted object: various colored flying objects reported by multiple witnesses
witnesses: civilians, local weather radar elements, SAC aircraft
